data.text:
**DEAR R&B STUDIOS / 505 GAMES - PLEASE RELEASE A MORE ACCURATE ENGLISH SUBTITLE**

Dear R&B Studios / 505 Games - Please release a more accurate English Subtitle

Dear R&B Studios / 505 Games,

There is currently a bug/issue with the Eiyuden Chronicle game script in the English language

There are multiple examples of unprofessional translation/localisation, and also instances of real world political slurs that do not exist in the original Japanese script of the game

Can you please release an English Subtitle that is more accurate to the Japanese source material, without the unprofessional/antagonising lines

River City Girls Developers have previously solved their own English Localisation issue by releasing a second, more accurate English subtitle

We ask you to do the same as it is currently alienating potential and current customers to have real life politics and unprofessional lines that have nothing to do with the game's storyline be present in the English localisation

I will provide examples of those lines below to give more context

There are also many potential customers who cannot buy the game in its current English localisation format as it directly insults them in its current format. This is not fair to them either and sales will increase once this issue is fixed

By re-issuing a new more accurate English subtitle, paying customers can enjoy the Suikoden Successor you have spent years creating, and enjoy it as it was intended to respect Yoshitaka Murayama's legacy

Help us enjoy your game as you intended it to be

EDIT: I encourage everyone to post their bug reports about the localisation (under the localisation tab) here:

https://fs30.formsite.com/505games/hundredheroes/index

Also as Zen kindly pointed out, feel free to contact R&B studios directly via email to get this issue sorted:

Originally posted by Zen:

OP, you can email this directly to the developer. Their email address: contact@rabbitandbearstudios.com

edit:

Originally posted by LoafEye:

you're still in the minority.

We've been told by trolls that we are the 'minority' on this issue so i did some analysis of this thread itself:

People who are expressly requesting a fix to the English Localisation issue: FOR: 123 124 125 126 127 128 129 130 Unique Posters

People who are neither for or against but are "ok/fine" with current English Localisation: NEUTRAL : 28 Unique Posters

People are expressly against the notion of an accurate English Localisation : AGAINST: 6 Unique Posters

2100% more people want the change then do not, or 75% want this change expressly and 96.3% either want this change or are not inconvenienced by the change

Also curiously, you would expect as the OP of this post i would have the most posts within this 62 page thread, but that's not the case at all

Post Count:

1st: Loafeye - AGAINST: 75 posts

2nd: Tankanidis:- FOR (and OP of thread) 56 posts

3rd: Zio: 48 posts- AGAINST

So 2 out of the 3 top posters in this thread were from the 'against' side.

Congrats Loafeye on being #1 in posts in a thread you said :

Originally posted by LoafEye:

Yeah I don't care dude,

Also congrats to Zio, who managed to achieve #3rd even though 2/3 of your posts were deleted. Take heart in knowing if the Tally was sorted by word count, you'd still be #1st

TL:DR: 123 124 125 126 127 128 129 130 People signed this request for a more professional English Subtitle. 28 Neutral. 6 Against.

75% of people posting expressly want this change to happen.

96.3% of people posting want this change to happen or are not inconvenienced by a more accurate English language localisation subtitle

2100% more people want this to happen then do not want it to happen.

3.7% of people expressly DO NOT want this change to happen.

Most posts in top 3 posters were from people against it, with 123 posts coming from the top 2 people against the idea, even eclipsing the OP of the thread's post count greatly

edit:

Dear R&B Studio/505 Publishers this issue is too important and too expensive for you to ignore and not address. The single action of fixing the current English Localisation Subtitle is the most important financial decision you can make for the health of Eiyuden Chronicle: 100 Heroes. Please listen to your current customers, and your prospective customers and fix this issue!! TL:DR TL:DR TLDR:

There's between $2-$3 million dollars worth of customer purchases that directly states the current English Localisation Subtitle needs to be Fixed as priority
